intro: Cybianthus piresii, commonly known as the Piresii's cybianthus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, where it thrives in nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
